title: A standard Lucene install that works for simple web sites
description:
I'm new to Lucene.  I would like to be able to download a blob, install it, set a few settings, preferably in a GUI, and be on the air with search enabled on my static web site.

What I find on the Examples page is nothing like this.  It is a collection of stuff that leads me to believe that I'll have to become expert in all sorts of Lucene arcana before I can get to my goal.

comments.content:
Have you seen/tried the demo?
Various Lucene articles and Lucene in Action are all pretty gentle - no need to become an expert.
If you can, please contribute.
comments.author: Otis Gospodnetic

comments.content:
Lucene is a library for build applications that include search functionality – it is not itself an application.

If you want to down load an application that you can easily configure to automaticaly index a website, you should consider a product built using Lucene ... like Nutch perhaps?
comments.author: Hoss Man

comments.content: Is it appropriate / allowed to suggest lucene-based commercial search servers, that do what the reporter is after?
comments.author: Dejan Nenov

comments.content: No updates for over a year here. The goal of LUCENE-805 is it to improve the demos, which should be helpful for the user who opened this issue.
comments.author: Michael Busch
